critique: This document is an executive order extending peaceful nuclear cooperation with the European Atomic Energy Community. It cites the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 and previous executive orders. It asserts that failure to continue this cooperation would be seriously prejudicial to U.S. non-proliferation objectives and would jeopardize the common defense and security of the United States. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt. The document does not directly address immigration. The extension of an existing agreement could be seen as a neutral stance on executive power. The document does not directly address federalism. The document emphasizes national security. The document does not directly address economic regulation. The document does not directly address social inclusion.
